trans-unit.source: How to use the SendGrid email service (.NET) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use the SendGrid email service (.NET) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in C# and use the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in C# and use the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: How to Send Email Using SendGrid with Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Send Email Using SendGrid with Azure

trans-unit.source: Last Update: Feburary 24, 2015
trans-unit.target: Last Update: Feburary 24, 2015

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the

trans-unit.source: SendGrid email service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid email service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in C\#
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in C\#

trans-unit.source: and use the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: and use the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include **constructing
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include **constructing

trans-unit.source: email, **sending email, adding attachments, and **using
trans-unit.target: email, **sending email, adding attachments, and **using

trans-unit.source: filters**.
trans-unit.target: filters**.

trans-unit.target: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the

trans-unit.source: What is the SendGrid email service?
trans-unit.target: What is the SendGrid email service?

trans-unit.source: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable
trans-unit.target: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable

trans-unit.source: [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs
trans-unit.target: [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs

trans-unit.source: that make custom integration easy.
trans-unit.target: that make custom integration easy.

trans-unit.target: Common SendGrid usage scenarios

trans-unit.target: include:

trans-unit.target: Automatically sending receipts to customers.

trans-unit.target: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly

trans-unit.source: e-fliers and special offers.
trans-unit.target: e-fliers and special offers.

trans-unit.source: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked email, and
trans-unit.target: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked email, and

trans-unit.source: customer responsiveness.
trans-unit.target: customer responsiveness.

trans-unit.target: Generating reports to help identify trends.

trans-unit.source: Forwarding customer inquiries.
trans-unit.target: Forwarding customer inquiries.

trans-unit.target: Processing incoming emails.

trans-unit.source: Reference the SendGrid .NET class library
trans-unit.target: Reference the SendGrid .NET class library

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText><title></title></link> is the easiest way to get the SendGrid API
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText><title></title></link> is the easiest way to get the SendGrid API

trans-unit.source: and to configure your application with all dependencies.
trans-unit.target: and to configure your application with all dependencies.

trans-unit.source: NuGet is a
trans-unit.target: NuGet is a

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio extension included with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 that makes it easy to install and update
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio extension included with Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 that makes it easy to install and update

trans-unit.source: libraries and tools.
trans-unit.target: libraries and tools.

trans-unit.source: To install NuGet if you are running a version of Visual Studio earlier than Visual Studio 2012, visit http://www.nuget.org, and click the Install NuGet button.
trans-unit.target: To install NuGet if you are running a version of Visual Studio earlier than Visual Studio 2012, visit http://www.nuget.org, and click the Install NuGet button.

trans-unit.source: To install the SendGrid NuGet package in your application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To install the SendGrid NuGet package in your application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click References, then click
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click References, then click

trans-unit.source: Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: In the left-hand pane of the Manage NuGet Packages dialog, click Online.
trans-unit.target: In the left-hand pane of the Manage NuGet Packages dialog, click Online.

trans-unit.source: Search for SendGrid and select the SendGrid item in the
trans-unit.target: Search for SendGrid and select the SendGrid item in the

trans-unit.source: results list (the current version is 5.0.0).
trans-unit.target: results list (the current version is 5.0.0).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SendGrid NuGet package</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Install to complete the installation, and then close this
trans-unit.target: Click Install to complete the installation, and then close this

trans-unit.source: dialog.
trans-unit.target: dialog.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid's .NET class library is called SendGridMail.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid's .NET class library is called SendGridMail.

trans-unit.source: It contains
trans-unit.target: It contains

trans-unit.source: the following namespaces:
trans-unit.target: the following namespaces:

trans-unit.source: SendGridMail for creating and working with email items.
trans-unit.target: SendGridMail for creating and working with email items.

trans-unit.source: SendGridMail.Transport for sending email using either the
trans-unit.target: SendGridMail.Transport for sending email using either the

trans-unit.source: SMTP protocol, or the HTTP 1.1 protocol with Web/REST.
trans-unit.target: SMTP protocol, or the HTTP 1.1 protocol with Web/REST.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code namespace declarations to the top of any C\# file
trans-unit.target: Add the following code namespace declarations to the top of any C\# file

trans-unit.source: in which you want to programmatically access the SendGrid email service.
trans-unit.target: in which you want to programmatically access the SendGrid email service.

trans-unit.source: System.Net and System.Net.Mail are .NET Framework namespaces
trans-unit.target: System.Net and System.Net.Mail are .NET Framework namespaces

trans-unit.source: that are included because they include types you will commonly use with
trans-unit.target: that are included because they include types you will commonly use with

trans-unit.source: the SendGrid APIs.
trans-unit.target: the SendGrid APIs.

trans-unit.target: can set properties and methods, including the

trans-unit.source: How to: Send an email
trans-unit.target: How to: Send an email

trans-unit.source: After creating an email message, you can send it using
trans-unit.target: After creating an email message, you can send it using

trans-unit.source: the Web API provided by SendGrid.
trans-unit.target: the Web API provided by SendGrid.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you may <link><linkText>use .NET's built in library</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you may <link><linkText>use .NET's built in library</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Sending email requires that you supply your
trans-unit.target: Sending email requires that you supply your

trans-unit.source: SendGrid account credentials (username and password).
trans-unit.target: SendGrid account credentials (username and password).

trans-unit.source: The following code
trans-unit.target: The following code

trans-unit.source: demonstrates how to wrap your credentials in a NetworkCredential
trans-unit.target: demonstrates how to wrap your credentials in a NetworkCredential

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to send a message using the Web API.
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to send a message using the Web API.

trans-unit.source: How to: Add an attachment
trans-unit.target: How to: Add an attachment

trans-unit.source: Attachments can be added to a message by calling the AddAttachment
trans-unit.target: Attachments can be added to a message by calling the AddAttachment

trans-unit.source: method and specifying the name and path of the file you want to attach.
trans-unit.target: method and specifying the name and path of the file you want to attach.

trans-unit.source: You can include multiple attachments by calling this method once for
trans-unit.target: You can include multiple attachments by calling this method once for

trans-unit.source: each file you wish to attach.
trans-unit.target: each file you wish to attach.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates adding
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates adding

trans-unit.source: an attachment to a message:
trans-unit.target: an attachment to a message:

trans-unit.source: You can also add attachments from the data's Stream.
trans-unit.target: You can also add attachments from the data's Stream.

trans-unit.source: It can be done by calling the same method as above, AddAttachment, but by passing in the Stream of the data, and the filename you want it to show as in the message.
trans-unit.target: It can be done by calling the same method as above, AddAttachment, but by passing in the Stream of the data, and the filename you want it to show as in the message.

trans-unit.source: In this case you will need to add the System.IO library.
trans-unit.target: In this case you will need to add the System.IO library.

trans-unit.source: How to: Use apps to enable footers, tracking, and analytics
trans-unit.target: How to: Use apps to enable footers, tracking, and analytics

trans-unit.source: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of
trans-unit.target: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of

trans-unit.source: apps.
trans-unit.target: apps.

trans-unit.source: These are settings that can be added to an email message to
trans-unit.target: These are settings that can be added to an email message to

trans-unit.source: enable specific functionality such as click tracking, Google analytics,
trans-unit.target: enable specific functionality such as click tracking, Google analytics,

trans-unit.source: subscription tracking, and so on.
trans-unit.target: subscription tracking, and so on.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of apps, see
trans-unit.target: For a full list of apps, see

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>App Settings[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>App Settings[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Apps can be applied to SendGrid email messages using methods
trans-unit.target: Apps can be applied to SendGrid email messages using methods

trans-unit.source: implemented as part of the SendGrid class.
trans-unit.target: implemented as part of the SendGrid class.
